name: Novotel Sydney Manly Pacific

reviews.text: Grabbed a 1 night stay at the Manly Pacific Beach hotel, now run by Novotel, on wotif.com for a great price. The website alerted us that the hotel was undergoing renovations but assured us that it was between 9-5pm. Lucky for us, they were right and we had no issues with any of the renovations. The only sign of it was one of the elevators being worked on, and some scaffolding on one side of the bldg's exterior.
reviews.title: Great hotel and fun location

likes.liked: — Great location, nice clean rooms with great view

reviews.text: Inside the rooms are in great condition with fabulous balconies overlooking North Steyne section of Many Beach. It's a great location because you are 4-5 minutes walk away from the busy nightlife and restaurant section of Manly and the Corso, but far enough away that you don't get the noise. We could actually hear the waves crashing all night long, despite the fact that the hotel is across the street from the beach. (There are no hotels in Manly that are right on the beach.)
reviews.title: Manly pacific will be dearer next time

reviews.text: My kids loved the little welcome gifts from the hotel, and the movie choices. The room service wasn't anything spectacular, but it was fine. We'd definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Good Experience at Manly Pacific
Great location with big rooms
reviews.text: Stayed in Manly pacific for 4 nights in early June 2008. Good hotel, great location. The renovation did not disturb us at all. The hotel did a good job in containing them whilst we were there.
Morning breakfast was bad on saturday, long waiting time but other days is OK. Breakfast spread is good, daugthers fascinated by the auto pan cakes maker.
reviews.title: Good spot

reviews.text: staying in manly then this hotel is the perfect location right opposite the surf beach. the rooftop pool and spa is small but has the best view!. the gym is small and cramped - i would suggest a run along the beach if you want to stay fit! our room was of a good size and with a large balcony but was not serviced until after lunch so that was quite annoying. there was a good choice from the breakfast buffet but if breakfast is not included in the price you might want to try one of the many cafes nearby. dinner was reasonably priced for a hotel. alterations are currently taking place altough the noise was not at all troublesome. this hotel is close to buses, ferries and the shops. ( manly has some of the best surf shops you will find )
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: This hotel is not the worst I have stayed in, but it comes close to it. For one, the rooms are in need of a face lift, very tired ocean view rooms and I would imagine the other's too, except for the new section. Service is generally ok, the restaurant manager wasn't helpful and even a little arrogant when we asked about pricing, seating times and other restaurant specific details; and I received a letter from the duty manager with many spelling mistakes which was a little unprofessional!
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night and went for an ocean view room which I think is essential as the rest of the experience wasn't stunning.
reviews.title: Tired but okay for a short stay

reviews.text: The hotel is pretty tired these days. 2-3* I would suggest. the hotel is clean though and fine for a short stay, longer if u're happy with the tiredness aspect. Our shower for example needed a little DIY to make it work properly.
reviews.title: There are better hotels in Manly

reviews.text: There is some renovation work going on but nothing that I could see that will make much difference to our experience. We weren't impacted by the renovation work other than one of the two lifts not working.
reviews.title: Appalling

reviews.text: The hotel seemed very busy - I queued for 15 mins to check in and queued to check out. I also had to wait 5 mins for the concierge to return to the desk as they were busy elsewhere.
reviews.title: Fantasic Service

likes.disliked: — Very minor, 1st night lift was under repair.

reviews.text: For what we paid, only the location and ocean view made it even close to value for money. It's a 5 min walk into Manly and 30 secs to the beach.
reviews.title: Magic Spot overlooking the beach

reviews.text: We recently had an overnight stay at the Novotel Manly. The hotel has just finished refurbishment. We had an ocean view room, view was spectacular overlooking Manly beach with a lovely (very clean) private balcony. The beds were exceptional, soft yet supportive with quality linen. I don't think I have ever had such a comfortable sleep in a hotel before.
reviews.title: Lovely Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the their restaurant for dinner, the menu was limited and quite pricey for what you get. I would try one of the other restaurants around town, there are many of them. However, breakfast was lovely.
reviews.title: very average

reviews.text: The pool area nice and clean, the kids loved it. The hotel also has bar area/ brasserie with large glass windows that open up, really beautiful area. Overall we had a fabulous time and would totally recommend! Oh and go to a little shop call "Burger Me' to grab a burger by the beach...best burgers ever, yum!
reviews.title: Just alright.

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel as part of a 3 week trip to Oz and I can honestly say that this was the most disappointing place, despite being one of the most expensive. Reception staff lacked customer service training, food and drink overpriced- plenty of fab places nearby though, pool very small compared to pictures on internet although the lovely Shelly Beach about a 10 minute walk. Myself and my partner did not spend much time in the hotel at all to be honest, not even a few drinks in the bar- a first for us- as the hotel lacked any atmosphere at all. I will be avoiding Novotel in the future.
reviews.title: Fabulous location-shame about the renovations!

aka: Novotel Sydney Manly Pacific Hotel Manly
description: The newly-refurbished Novotel Sydney Manly Pacific is a 4-star hotel situated on iconic Manly Beach. Located just 30 minutes from Circular Quay and Sydney city by ferry and offering spectacular views, this oceanfront hotel is ideally positioned for holidays and business travel. Boasting extensive conferencing facilities and 213 contemporary rooms, the hotel also features a restaurant and three bars, plus a rooftop pool, gym, sauna and spa.
